dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in September 2022, Pope Francis made that historic visit to Kazakhstan for the Congress of Leaders of World and Traditional Religions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in September twenty twenty two, Pope Francis made that historic visit to Kazakhstan for the Congress of Leaders of World and Traditional Religions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pope Francis visited Kazakhstan in September 2022 for the Seventh Congress of Leaders of World and Traditional Religions, marking one of his rare international trips in his later years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he was dealing with some health issues at the time, right? But he still called the trip vital for peace and interfaith dialogue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he was dealing with some health issues at the time, right? But he still called the trip vital for peace and interfaith dialogue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite ongoing health issues at the time, he described the journey as vital for promoting peace, interfaith dialogue, and human solidarity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. He praised Kazakhstan as a 'place of encounter and dialogue'—really highlighted their efforts in religious harmony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. He praised Kazakhstan as a 'place of encounter and dialogue'-really highlighted their efforts in religious harmony.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During his visit, Pope Francis praised Kazakhstan as a 'place of encounter and dialogue' and commended its efforts to foster religious harmony in a diverse society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I love that he quoted the Kazakh poet Abai during his speech. 'The beginning of humanity is love and justice'—such a powerful line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I love that he quoted the Kazakh poet Abai during his speech. 'The beginning of humanity is love and justice'-such a powerful line.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One of the most memorable moments came when the pontiff quoted Kazakh poet Abai, stating, 'The beginning of humanity is love and justice'.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then he went on to talk about the dombra, Kazakhstan's national instrument. Called it a symbol of continuity in diversity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then he went on to talk about the dombra, Kazakhstan's national instrument. Called it a symbol of continuity in diversity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pope also reflected on Kazakhstan's national instrument, the dombra, calling it a 'symbol of continuity in diversity'.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, with the two strings representing harmony between contrasting forces—like tradition and progress. President Tokayev even gifted him one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, with the two strings representing harmony between contrasting forces-like tradition and progress. President Tokayev even gifted him one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a speech to civil society representatives, he noted how the two strings of the dombra represent the country's ability to maintain harmony between contrasting forces - such as tradition and progress, or harsh winters and hot summers. President Tokayev later gifted the pontiff a dombra as a token of appreciation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Tokayev said the Pope became the best ambassador of Kazakh culture and the dombra after that visit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tokayev said the Pope became the best ambassador of Kazakh culture and the dombra after that visit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Everyone now says the best ambassador of Kazakh culture and the dombra is the Pope himself, Tokayev said at the time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He also interpreted their flag, didn't he? The golden eagle as earthly power, blue for transcendence—urging balance between politics and spirituality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He also interpreted their flag, didn't he? The golden eagle as earthly power, blue for transcendence-urging balance between politics and spirituality.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pope Francis also spoke about Kazakhstan's national flag, interpreting the golden eagle as a symbol of earthly power and the blue background as a sign of transcendence. He stressed the importance of maintaining a healthy balance between politics and spirituality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And let's not forget the public Mass in Astana—tens of thousands showed up. He later called Kazakhstan a 'model of civilization and courage.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And let's not forget the public Mass in Astana-tens of thousands showed up. He later called Kazakhstan a 'model of civilization and courage.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Throughout his apostolic visit, the pontiff met with President Tokayev, participated in interfaith dialogue, and held a public Mass attended by tens of thousands of believers in Astana. He later described Kazakhstan as a 'model of civilization and courage', praising the country's commitment to religious tolerance and peaceful coexistence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even in 2024, he showed solidarity again, offering prayers for flood victims there. And Tokayev visited the Vatican that same year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even in twenty twenty four, he showed solidarity again, offering prayers for flood victims there. And Tokayev visited the Vatican that same year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2024, Pope Francis once again showed solidarity with Kazakhstan, offering prayers for the victims of devastating floods in the country. That same year, President Tokayev paid an official visit to the Vatican, underscoring the strong diplomatic and spiritual ties between Kazakhstan and the Holy See.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's clear his impact went way beyond that one trip. His humility and focus on global peace really left a mark.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's clear his impact went way beyond that one trip. His humility and focus on global peace really left a mark.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Kazakhstan's mourning alongside the world, but his words and spirit will stay with them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Kazakhstan's mourning alongside the world, but his words and spirit will stay with them.
